instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime loop
threads.message:
hi

working on a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a

the board powers on and chime sounds again and again
also, after smc reset or pram reset back to chime in loop...

liquid damaged around <DIODE>D2920</DIODE> <CAPACITOR>C8300</CAPACITOR> looks also burned..

also around <CAPACITOR>C8051</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R8052</RESISTOR>

haven't replaced anything yet..

anything worth to measure or check before starting to work on this one?
those chimes could be RAM related? the RAM looks very clean though..

thanks..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime loop
threads.message: Echo Chime is usually RAM or CPU issue. Is there crap under the RAM or CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime loop
threads.message:
i will take out the heasink and look

the RAM looks very clean on both sides.. one burned capacitor on the back near the RAM..

i will check the cpu area and update...

btw, those chime loop is what called "beeps" that are related to RAM?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime loop
threads.message: A beep is totally different from a chime!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime loop
threads.message:
ok thanks, just never ran into a beep in a macbook...

so i've done this diagnosing..
the cpu and ram area looks very clean, no visible corrosion..
i replaced the next parts that was corroded around the board..
<CAPACITOR>C8300</CAPACITOR>
<DIODE>D2920</DIODE>

<CAPACITOR>C8030</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C2350</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C8051</CAPACITOR>

all of those was corroded or burned and were replaced..

i noticed that the board only chimes echo when the lcd is connected..
when it's disconnected it only chimes once.. BUT when connecting HDMI monitor
i get horizontal an vertical lines, and no image...

i noticed when the lcd connected i get 44v on <CAPACITOR>C8300</CAPACITOR>
not sure if suppose to be so high...

the LCD itself is good, checked it on another machine...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime loop
threads.message:
44v would indicate an open circuit so if the LCD works on another machine the connector is probably bad.
The lines and garbage on external would still indicate a RAM or CPU issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime loop
threads.message:
hi

the lcd is good with another board

the lines and garbage on hdmi screen, with the lcd disconnected meaning the board is toast?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime loop
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime loop
threads.message:
thank you louis and duke..

can you please give your thoughts on the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with keyboard not working..
i just posted all the reading from the TPAD connector..

[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/38274-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-no-keyboard/page2[/url]

many thanks...
